items.description: North Sea coast at Skipsea, Hornsea and Mappleton
items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued due to strong winds, surge and high spring tides on the coast from tomorrow, Wednesday 21/08/2024 and over the coming days. Areas most at risk include the North Sea coast from Skipsea to Mappleton, including Hornsea. Flooding is possible between 5:45AM and 8AM tomorrow, Wednesday 21/08/2024. We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next few days and as a result we may issue further alerts / warnings. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 11PM on Wednesday 21/08/2024, or as the situation changes.

A flood alert has been issued as a result of high tides, flooding is expected over the next 4 days with tides peaking Thursday evening 22/08/24. Conditions may apply for an hour either side of high tide. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow. Predicted peaks today Tuesday evening 20/08/24:- Newport 7.0m to 7.3m at 20:45. Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m at 20:45.  No thresholds are expected to be crossed on Wednesday mornings tide but they are rising again for Wednesday evening.  We are closely monitoring the situation. Please stay away from large waves as they are dangerous. This message will be updated by 11:00 on Wednesday, 21/08/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued due to strong winds, surge and high spring tides on the coast from tomorrow, Wednesday 21/08/2024 and over the coming days. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads in the Spurn Road, Southfield Farm and Kilnsea Caravan park areas. Flooding of coastal roads and footpaths along coast frontages is likely. Flooding is possible between 5:45AM and 9AM tomorrow, Wednesday 21/08/2024. We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next few days and as a result we may issue further alerts/warnings. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 11PM on Wednesday 21/08/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible with the midday tide today, 20/08/2024, but not expected. Further flooding is possible on the overnight tide tonight, 20/08/2024 into tomorrow, 21/08/2024 due to spring tides and strong winds over the next few days. Therefore the flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include Tiger's Tail, Wyre Dock, Burrow's Marsh, Burn Naze, Thornton, Trunnah, Stanah, Poulton-le-Fylde, Skippool, Hambleton, Cold Row, Little Singleton, Little Eccleston and Crow Woods. We are closely monitoring the situation.
Take care along promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. This message will be updated by 5:00pm on 20/08/2024 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible with the midday tide today, 20/08/2024, but not expected. However, further flooding is possible on the overnight tide tonight, 20/08/2024 into tomorrow, 21/08/2024, due to spring tides and strong winds over the next few days. Therefore the flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale. We have closed the flood gates at Arnside promenade, these will remain closed throughout the high tide cycle. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 5:00 PM on 20/08/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: This flood alert has been issued due to high tides and surge on the coast this afternoon, Tuesday 20/08/2024 and tomorrow morning, Wednesday 21/08/2024. Areas most at risk include The Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall. Flooding of coastal roads is possible between 5:30PM-9:30PM, this evening Tuesday 20/08/2024 and between 5:30AM-9:30AM, tomorrow morning, Wednesday 21/08/2024. We are closely monitoring the situation. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. This message will be updated by 11PM on Wednesday 21/08/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Hessle Haven to Faxfleet
items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued due to strong winds, surge and high spring tides on the coast. Flooding is possible from tomorrow, Wednesday 21/08/2024 between 7:15AM – 10AM. Areas most at risk include The Humber estuary from Hessle Haven to Faxfleet. Flooding of coastal roads and footpaths along coast frontages is likely. We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next few days and as a result we may issue further alerts or warnings. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 11PM on Wednesday 21/08/2024, or as the situation changes.
